name: Modules.TouchId
summary: Allows a Titanium application to use the iOS Touch ID authentication mechanism.

methods.name: authenticate
methods.description:
A special note for Android:

When you call this method in Android, if you provide an incorrect fingerprint and receive an error message "Unable to recognize fingerprint", do not call authenticate. Instead, get the user to try again. If you call authenticate, it will end up in a bad state. This flow will be improved in the next update for Android.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: Dictionary of arguments passed to the method, e.g. the reason to autheicate and the callback.

methods.name: deviceCanAuthenticate
methods.summary: Checks to see if device is configured for Touch ID authentication.
methods.description:
On Android this takes into account the authenticationPolicy.

Example:

var TiTouchId = require("ti.touchid");
var result = TiTouchId.deviceCanAuthenticate();
if (!result.canAuthenticate) {
    alert('Message: ' + result.error + '\nCode: ' + result.code);
} else {
    alert('Device can authenticate');
}

methods.name: invalidate
methods.description:
The context is invalidated automatically when it is (auto)released.

This method allows invalidating it manually while it is still in scope. Invalidation terminates any existing policy evaluation and the respective call will fail with ERROR_APP_CANCELLED. After the context has been invalidated, it can not be used for policy evaluation and an attempt to do so will fail with ERROR_INVALID_CONTEXT.

See the "Lifetime Notes (iOS-only)" paragraph in the module paragraph for more infos.

methods.name: isSupported
methods.summary: Determines if the current device supports Touch ID.

properties.name: authenticationPolicy
properties.summary: Sets the global authentication policy used in this Touch ID context.
properties.description: You should set this property before checking the availability or starting the authentication. By default, AUTHENTICATION_POLICY_BIOMETRICS will be used to authenticate using the Touch ID sensor only. Using the AUTHENTICATION_POLICY_PASSCODE constant will still try to authenticate with Touch ID first and use the passcode as the fallback.

constants.name: ACCESS_CONTROL_AND
constants.summary: Constraint logic operation - When using more than one constraint, all must be satisfied.

constants.name: ACCESS_CONTROL_APPLICATION_PASSWORD
constants.summary: Security: Application provided password for data encryption key generation. This is not a constraint but additional item encryption mechanism.

constants.name: ACCESS_CONTROL_DEVICE_PASSCODE
constants.summary: Constraint - Device passcode.

constants.name: ACCESS_CONTROL_OR
constants.summary: Constraint logic operation - When using more than one constraint, at least one of them must be satisfied.

constants.name: ACCESS_CONTROL_PRIVATE_KEY_USAGE
constants.summary: Create access control for private key operations (i.e. sign operation).

constants.name: ACCESS_CONTROL_TOUCH_ID_ANY
constants.summary: Constraint - Touch ID (any finger). Touch ID must be available and at least one finger must be enrolled. Item is still accessible by Touch ID even if fingers are added or removed.

constants.name: ACCESS_CONTROL_TOUCH_ID_CURRENT_SET
constants.summary: Constraint - Touch ID from the set of currently enrolled fingers. Touch ID must be available and at least one finger must be enrolled. When fingers are added or removed, the item is invalidated.

constants.name: ACCESS_CONTROL_USER_PRESENCE
constants.summary: User presence policy using Touch ID or Passcode. Touch ID does not have to be available or enrolled. Item is still accessible by Touch ID even if fingers are added or removed.

constants.name: ACCESSIBLE_AFTER_FIRST_UNLOCK
constants.summary: Item data can only be accessed once the device has been unlocked after a restart. This is recommended for items that need to be accesible by background applications. Items with this attribute will migrate to a new device when using encrypted backups.

constants.name: ACCESSIBLE_AFTER_FIRST_UNLOCK_THIS_DEVICE_ONLY
constants.summary: Item data can only be accessed once the device has been unlocked after a restart. This is recommended for items that need to be accessible by background applications. Items with this attribute will never migrate to a new device, so after a backup is restored to a new device these items will be missing.

constants.name: ACCESSIBLE_ALWAYS
constants.summary:
Item data can always be accessed regardless of the lock state of the device.
This is not recommended for anything except system use. Items with this attribute will migrate to a new device when using encrypted backups.

constants.name: ACCESSIBLE_ALWAYS_THIS_DEVICE_ONLY
constants.summary: Item data can always be accessed regardless of the lock state of the device. This option is not recommended for anything except system use. Items with this attribute will never migrate to a new device, so after a backup is restored to a new device, these items will be missing.

constants.name: ACCESSIBLE_WHEN_PASSCODE_SET_THIS_DEVICE_ONLY
constants.summary: Item data can only be accessed while the device is unlocked. This class is only available if a passcode is set on the device. This is recommended for items that only need to be accessible while the application is in the foreground. Items with this attribute will never migrate to a new device, so after a backup is restored to a new device, these items will be missing. No items can be stored in this class on devices without a passcode. Disabling the device passcode will cause all items in this class to be deleted.

constants.name: ACCESSIBLE_WHEN_UNLOCKED
constants.summary: Item data can only be accessed while the device is unlocked. This is recommended for items that only need be accesible while the application is in the foreground. Items with this attribute will migrate to a new device when using encrypted backups.

constants.name: ACCESSIBLE_WHEN_UNLOCKED_THIS_DEVICE_ONLY
constants.summary: Item data can only be accessed while the device is unlocked. This is recommended for items that only need be accesible while the application is in the foreground. Items with this attribute will never migrate to a new device, so after a backup is restored to a new device, these items will be missing.

constants.name: AUTHENTICATION_POLICY_BIOMETRICS
constants.summary: Device owner was authenticated using a biometric method (Touch ID).
constants.description:
Touch ID authentication is required. If Touch ID is not available or not enrolled, policy evaluation will fail. If Touch ID is locked out, passcode is required as the first step to unlock the Touch ID.

Touch ID authentication dialog contains a cancel button with default title "Cancel" which can be customized using cancelTitle property and a fallback button with default title "Enter Password" which can be customized using fallbackTitle property. Fallback button is initially hidden and shows up after first unsuccessful Touch ID attempt. Tapping cancel button or fallback button causes evaluatePolicy call to fail, returning a distinct error code.

Biometric authentication will get locked after 5 unsuccessful attempts. After that, users have to unlock it by entering passcode.

constants.name: AUTHENTICATION_POLICY_PASSCODE
constants.summary: Device owner was authenticated by Touch ID or device passcode.
constants.description:
Touch ID or passcode authentication is required. If Touch ID is available, enrolled and not locked out, user is asked for it first, otherwise they are asked to enter device passcode. If passcode is not enabled, policy evaluation will fail.

Touch ID authentication dialog behaves similarly as the one used by AUTHENTICATION_POLICY_BIOMETRICS. However, instead of "Enter Password" button there is "Enter Passcode" button which, when tapped, switches the authentication method and allows users to enter device passcode.

Passcode authentication will get locked after 6 unsuccessful attempts with progressively increased backoff delay.

constants.name: ERROR_APP_CANCELLED
constants.summary: Constant indicating that the app cancelled authentication.

constants.name: ERROR_AUTHENTICATION_FAILED
constants.summary: Constant indicating that the authentication was not successful.

constants.name: ERROR_INVALID_CONTEXT
constants.summary: Constant indicating that there is an invalid context.

constants.name: ERROR_KEY_PERMANENTLY_INVALIDATED
constants.summary: Constant indicating that the key has been permanentely invalidated.

constants.name: ERROR_PASSCODE_NOT_SET
constants.summary: Constant indicating that the passcode is not set for the device.

constants.name: ERROR_SYSTEM_CANCEL
constants.summary: Constant indicating that iOS cancelled authentication, for example, if another application enters the foreground.

constants.name: ERROR_TOUCH_ID_LOCKOUT
constants.summary: Constant indicating that Touch ID has locked out.

constants.name: ERROR_TOUCH_ID_NOT_AVAILABLE
constants.summary: Constant indicating that Touch ID is not available on the device.

constants.name: ERROR_TOUCH_ID_NOT_ENROLLED
constants.summary: Constant indicating that Touch ID does not have any enrolled fingerprints.

constants.name: ERROR_USER_CANCEL
constants.summary: Constant indicating that the user canceled authentication.

constants.name: ERROR_USER_FALLBACK
constants.summary: Constant indicating that the user tapped the fallback button to enter their passcode.

constants.name: FINGERPRINT_ACQUIRED_IMAGER_DIRTY
constants.summary: The fingerprint image was too noisy due to suspected or detected dirt on the sensor.

constants.name: FINGERPRINT_ACQUIRED_INSUFFICIENT
constants.summary: The fingerprint image was too noisy to process due to a detected condition (i.e. dry skin) or a possibly dirty sensor.

constants.name: FINGERPRINT_ACQUIRED_PARTIAL
constants.summary: Only a partial fingerprint image was detected.

constants.name: FINGERPRINT_ACQUIRED_TOO_FAST
constants.summary: The fingerprint image was incomplete due to quick motion.

constants.name: FINGERPRINT_ACQUIRED_TOO_SLOW
constants.summary: The fingerprint image was unreadable due to lack of motion.
